In lazy_regex_proc_macros

Macro lazy_regex_proc_macros::regex_captures

source · [−]
regex_captures!() { /* proc-macro */ }
Expand description

Extract captured groups as a tuple of &str.

If there’s no match, the macro returns None.

If an optional group has no value, the tuple will contain "" instead.

Example:

let (whole, name, version) = regex_captures!(
    r#"(\w+)-([0-9.]+)"#, // a literal regex
    "This is lazy_regex-2.0!", // any expression
).unwrap();
assert_eq!(whole, "lazy_regex-2.0");
assert_eq!(name, "lazy_regex");
assert_eq!(version, "2.0");
